awd_abstract_narration: Zhang's research covers a broad range of problems in                       probability theory, he will work on normalized random walks,                    local limit theorems, large deviations, and renewal theory.  In                 sequential analysis, problems in nonlinear renewal theory,                      power-one tests and confidence sequences, multi-decision and                    selection, clinical trials, multi-armed bandit, and optimal                     stopping will be persued.  Problems in statistical inference                    include those involving empirical Bayes estimation, mixture                     models, testing and estimation under biased sampling schemes,                   information and asymptotic efficiency, and large sample theory.                      Zhang's research involves a wide variety of problems in                    the fields of probability and statistics.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
